task.title: How to Configure an XQJ Data Source

context.p: Any transformer that offers an XQJ API implementation can be used when validating XQuery or transforming XML documents.

step.cmd: If your XQJ Implementation is native, make sure the directory containing the native libraries of the engine is added to your system environment variables: to PATH - on Windows, to LD_LIBRARY_PATH - on Linux, or to DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH - on macOS. Restart after configuring the environment variables.
Select XQuery API for Java (XQJ) in the Type combo box.
Click the Add button to add XQJ API-specific files.
step.info: You can manage the driver files using the Add, Remove, Detect, and Stop buttons.
step.stepresult: detects any implementation of javax.xml.xquery.XQDataSource and presents it in Driver class field.

step.cmd: Select the most suited driver in the Driver class combo box.
Continue on to configure the XQJ connection.
